intro: Trisyngyne starkenborghiorum, commonly known as the Starkenborghian tristyngyne, is a rare and unique flowering plant characterized by its complex floral structure. It belongs to the family Tristyngyaceae and is notable for its three stamens, which are fused into a single structure known as a syngyne. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with vibrant colors, typically ranging from deep red to orange. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is found in specific regions of South America. Due to its rarity and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
